content:
/>
X.iv.2.B.3.c
.
Homicide Committed While Insane
If the claimant or beneficiary caused the death of the Veteran or another beneficiary, and it is established that such act was committed while insane, the killing will
not
bar the claimant from receiving survivors benefits.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section B  - Considering Eligibility When Homicide Is Involved
citation: Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section B
